availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Shelton Parker (Jefferson County. Kentucky, bookkeeper and notary public)

body.p:
Jefferson County, Kentucky, clerk, bookkeeper, and notary. Kentucky native. Son of Amos P. Parker and Almira Parker. Married to Anna Maria Parker. Father of Alice B. Parker.
Student in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eight enslaved people in Louisville in 1850. Clerk in Louisville in 1860. Clerk and bookkeeper for C.N. Warren & Company in Louisville in 1862. Notary public in Louisville in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 3, p. 240A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 3, p. 830.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 6, p. 345.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 9, p. 231B.
